testcase.purpose: Test 2dtransform property existence
this should make a small green square rotated 30 degrees and the browser should return the rotation as 30 degrees as the computed value NOT a matrix

testcase.purpose: The radio input element is an atomic inline element so it falls under the definition of transformable and should be affected by transformations as usual
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: The checkbox input element is an atomic inline element so it falls under the definition of transformable and should be affected by transformations as usual
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: The range input element is an atomic inline element so it falls under the definition of transformable and should be affected by transformations as usual
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: The datetime-local input element is an atomic inline element so it falls under the definition of transformable and should be affected by transformations as usual
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: The definition of transformable element includes atomic inline-level elements such as images but not regular inline-level elements such as spans
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: a parent element has a transform of 10% with a height/width of 400px and the child has transform: inherit and a height/width of 100px
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: An img is a transformable element so transforms should work on it the same as any image
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: This test ensures that transforms cannot move the contents of an iframe onto the parent page
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: Transforms need to work on boxes of generated content just as on any other boxes. This file tests a generated inline Box
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: Transforms need to work on boxes of generated content just as on any other boxes. This file tests a generated block Box
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: List-items are block-level elements so should transform the same as blocks
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: Inline-tables are atomic inline-level elements so should transform the same as blocks
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: Inline-blocks are block-level elements so should transform the same as blocks
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: This just tests that a transform on a container div moves its contents not just the div itself
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: Inline-blocks are atomic inline-level elements so should transform the same as blocks
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: the transform is applied to the body element but the root element's background is transparent so the background is actually on the root element instead of the body
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: This test differs from transform-abspos-002.html in that the outer div has display: inline-table which might cause it to render differently in buggy Uas
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: This test differs from transform-abspos-001.html in that the outer div is a table which might cause buggy rendering engines to treat it differently
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: This test differs from transform-abspos-001.html in that it uses the right/bottom properties for positioning instead of top/left
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: This test differs from the previous in that it uses right/bottom properties for positioning instead of left/top
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: This means fixed-position elements need to be rooted at a transformed ancestor rather than the viewport
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: absolutely positioned elements need to be rooted at a transformed ancestor just as though it had non-static Position
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: If zero value is passed to scale function it causes the element to disappear
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: If the second parameter of scale function is not provided it takes a value equal to the first. This transform causes the element to appear twice as long in both the X and Y axes
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: The transform scales the element to twice its size in both the X and Y directions and moves its origin to the top left corner
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms

testcase.purpose: Child square element is transformed (scaled to zero) along with the parent element
testcase.component: W3C_HTML5 APIs/DOM, Forms and Styles/CSS Transforms
